intro: Eucalyptus vernicosa, commonly known as the red gum, is a species of flowering plant in the myrtle family, Myrtaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia and is characterized by its smooth, flaky bark that peels in strips. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a white, powdery bloom. It produces small, globular clusters of flowers that are typically pale yellow to cream in color. The plant is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in woodland and heathland habitats.
